alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Roosevelt County; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 24 at 4:46PM MST until November 25 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches. Higher amounts around 1 foot likely across eastern Lincoln and southwest Chaves Counties. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Lincoln County, South Central Mountains, Curry County, De Baca County, Roosevelt County, Chaves County Plains, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
